show.title: Enter the Clones of Bruce
show.headline: The death of Bruce Lee gave birth to a new film subgenre: Bruceploitation

event.title: <show-title>Enter the Clones of Bruce</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See the hard-hitting kung fu doc with a real-life Bruce clone
event.description: After becoming an international martial arts sensation, the death of Bruce Lee left a dragon-sized hole in cinema that was impossible to fill – not that people didn’t try. Whether you prefer Bruce Li, Dragon Lee, or Bruce Liang, there’s a clone for you. ENTER THE CLONES OF BRUCE is a love letter to the original icon, the badass actors tasked with filling his shoes, and the cinematic awesomeness that is kung fu movies. Our friends at Fantastic Fest will be taking it on tour with one of the most prolific Bruce clones, Bruce Le, joining us along the way for live Q&As.

show.title: I'm "George Lucas": A Connor Ratliff Story
show.headline: The creator of "The George Lucas Talk Show" questions its need to continue

landscapeHeroImage.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

portraitHeroImage.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

posterImages.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

event.title: <show-title>I'm "George Lucas": A Connor Ratliff Story</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Live Q&A with the crew
event.description: Save your seat for a special screening of I'M "GEORGE LUCAS": A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY, a documentary that follows the creator of "The George Lucas Talk Show" as he questions the need for the show to continue amidst the little financial and career gains it provides. Stick around after the screening for an in-person Q&A with director/producer Ryan Jacobi, producer Annamaria Sofillas, co-star Griffin Newman, co-producer/co-star Patrick Cotnoir, and the film's subject, Connor Ratliff, who will be joining virtually. Documentary filmmaker David Farrier (TICKLED) will moderate the 4/20 Q&A.

show.title: Pulp Fiction

event.title: <show-title>Pulp Fiction</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do the twist at our PULP FICTION Movie Party
event.description:
PULP FICTION shook audiences around the world when it first arrived 30 years ago, lifting elements from a wide array of time-worn stories and weaving them together into something truly new. Considering its impact on film history and just how damn watchable it is, any time is a great time to celebrate this iconic achievement.

When you arrive, we'll provide you with an “adrenaline” shot pen in case you need a shot to the heart, candy cigarettes (just pretend they're Red Apple band), and a yellow coffee mug so you can enjoy some "serious gourmet sh*t" just like Jules.

So don’t be a square, daddio. Grab your honey bunny and cruise on down to the most fun, most bloody, most groovy Movie Party in town.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

show.title: The Big Lebowski
show.headline: The Coen Bros.' slacker odyssey really ties the room together

event.title: <show-title>The Big Lebowski</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: It's the greatest movie party ever, but that's just like, uh, our opinion, man
event.description:
You want a movie party? We can get you a movie party, believe me. There are ways, Dude. You don't wanna know about it, believe me.

With its endlessly quotable dialogue, twist-filled mystery, and iconic characters, THE BIG LEBOWSKI has become a fixture of modern pop culture. That’s why we’re putting together a movie party to celebrate the greatness that is El Duderino (we’re not into the whole “brevity” thing).

When you arrive, we’ll provide you with a bowling pin keychain to commemorate the forever-two-steps-behind Donny Kerabatsos, glow sticks that’ll make you feel like you’re a part of The Dude’s epic dream sequences, and much more.

So throw on your favorite shabby sweater and roll on down for THE BIG LEBOWSKI Movie Party. It’ll be far out.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
show.headline: It all begins...with a choice

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Eclipse</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do us an extraordinary honor and say yes to this interactive screening
event.description:
Every choice has its consequences, some more than others. For example, if you choose to join us for another interactive TWILIGHT screening, the consequence will be you having an incredible time at the movies.

We’re back for another Movie Party in the perpetually cloudy town of Forks, and we think this one will ECLIPSE all the rest. Edward’s back in town and Bella has a few big decisions to make. Will she go for the muscled-up werewolf she’s known since they were kids, or the immortal 17-year-old asking for her hand in marriage? Either way, we’ve got some themed props that you’re sure to imprint on, including custom-packaged hand warmers (in case you need to hide out on a snowy mountain), moon keychains, and Bella’s engagement ring (note: it will be a slightly less valuable recreation).

So book those seats before all the shows get filled with armies of newborns – we promise we won’t steal your reason for existing.

You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, and you’ll be politely asked not to fling any poop if something startles you.

event.headline: Eat your way through PTA's hazy, romantic detective jam
event.description: We’re pairing Paul Thomas Anderson’s hopped-up neo-noir with three munchie-busting courses at our Alamo Dankhouse 4/20 Feast, presented by Wana Brands. This prix fixe menu will feature our Kool Ranch Popcorn Munchie Crunch, Midnight Snack Mac & Cheese, and Puff Puff Parfait. Plus, every guest will get a far out sheet of custom-designed stickers. Learn more about this stoner-approved feast HERE.

show.title: The Greasy Strangler
show.headline: A father and son who run a disco walking tour compete for a woman's attention

event.title: <show-title>The Greasy Strangler</show-title> <event-type-title>Benefit Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Help us get a greasy strangler back on his feet
event.description: Alamo Drafthouse was built on showcasing and celebrating outsider cinema from daring artists – artists like Michael St. Michaels, a cult legend who could use some help right now. He’s on the mend from a recent hospital visit, but as we all know, those medical bills can be more slippery to deal with than a greased-up serial strangler. That’s why we’re showing his outrageously odd comedy-slasher masterpiece, THE GREASY STRANGLER, with 100% of ticket revenue going to his GoFundMe. Michael's co-stars will be attending screenings in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Austin, and San Antonio and will be doing zoom Q&As in other markets. If you’re not able to make a screening but are still feeling particularly greasy, please consider contributing directly.

eventType.title: Benefit Screening
eventType.headline: Raising money for our communities one ticket at a time.
eventType.description: From time to time, we devote our screens to raising money for good causes. Each situation is a little different – for more details, check out the individual show page.

Be sure to stick around after the show for a live chat with directors Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett (SCREAM VI, READY OR NOT). We’ll even have a few vampire-themed gifts to help you fit in with all the other bloodsuckers at your next ballet class.

show.title: Labyrinth
show.headline: The beloved '80s puppet fantasy film

event.title: <show-title>Labyrinth</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party, movie party all night long
event.description:
What could possibly be more magical than watching this iconic ‘80s fantasy conjured by Jim Henson, George Lucas, and David Bowie at the peak of their powers on the big screen? Feeling it come truly alive at an interactive screening with fellow fans.

With themed props like shiny stress balls to roll around in your hand, masquerade masks, mini hands, and orange balloons, it’s the next best thing to Jareth the Goblin King actually showing up at your bedroom window.

show.headline: Carpenter & Russell's unequivocally sublime action masterwork

show.title: The House of the Devil
show.headline: Talk on the phone. Finish your homework. Watch TV. DIE!

event.title: <show-title>The House of the Devil</show-title>
event.headline: Talk on the phone. Finish your homework. Watch TV. DIE!
event.description: Ti West’s THE HOUSE OF THE DEVIL very well may be the greatest horror film of its decade. The film is a slow-burning occult shocker, plotted with an emphasis on suspense and shot to recreate the glory days of ‘80s horror. Where some throwback films feel plastic and phony (and, at their worst, self-parodying), THE HOUSE OF THE DEVIL hits the nail firmly on the head – it works. West’s script and direction operate together to bring the characters to a boil, resulting in a third act that will paralyze you. Starring Jocelin Donahue (INSIDIOUS: CHAPTER TWO), Tom Noonan (THE MONSTER SQUAD), Mary Woronov (ROCK 'N' ROLL HIGH SCHOOL), AJ Bowen (YOU'RE NEXT), and a beautiful Greta Gerwig, just before she started to make it in Hollywood (in hip huggers!).

show.title: The Mask (1994)
show.headline: From zero to hero

event.title: <show-title>The Mask (1994)</show-title>
event.headline: “S-ssss-ssss-sssss-smokin'!”
event.description:
Men. YIKES. Throw a weird mask on a man? EVEN WORSE. Sorry. Let me start over. It’s part two of Queer Film Theory 101’s journey into the dark psyche of the '90s American male with the cartoonish and absurd 1994 classic THE MASK (all caps feel appropriate) staring one of our favorite fractured masculinity clowns, Jim Carrey, and featuring the amazing debut of Cameron Diaz. Just like a be-dragged Bugs Bunny seducing Elmer Fudd, THE MASK is surprisingly queer when you think about it. THE MASK is giving chaos bisexual by way of Tex Avery.

Stanly Ipkiss, a hapless bank employee and certified “nice guy,” happens upon an ancient mask of indeterminant and likely problematically racist origin. When he pops it on his wormy little mug, he’s suddenly transformed into the uncomfortably horny anti-hero THE MASK! Is this new persona just the ticket that Stanley needs to assert himself and win the affection of the sultrily Jessica Rabbit-coded Tina? Or will the unbridled and violent masculinity of his new alter-ego cause him to lose everything…perhaps even his life?

Chuck Russell’s adaptation of Doug Mahnke and John Arcudi’s much darker Dark Horse Comic series became one of the top-grossing films of 1994. Due to the success of THE MASK, ACE VENTURA: PET DETECTIVE, and DUMB AND DUMBER (all released in 1994), Jim Carrey became a household name, and millions of children across the world became a little more annoying. C’mon, you remember running around yelling, “Somebody stop me!” at anyone who would listen, right? What a nightmare. (Micheal Foulk)

landscapeHeroImage.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

portraitHeroImage.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

posterImages.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

event.title: <show-title>Monty Python and the Holy Grail</show-title> <event-type-title>Quote-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Recite the sacred words with your favorite knights
event.description:
Greetings, old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

Follow me into this special quote-along screening of our quest to seek the Holy Grail, but only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this screening is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

Fear not, ye’ will be equipped with themed props for the journey, including a mighty steed (coconuts) and a knightly weapon (inflatable sword) to take on all the animated monsters and Frenchmen on your path to glory.

show.headline: A curmudgeonly literature professor finds out he only has six months to live

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
